verses.text: Then the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites came near to Eleazar the priest, and to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the heads of the fathers’ houses of the tribes of the people of Israel;
verses.comment: Fathers' houses refers to the leadership clans among the Levites.

verses.text: And they spoke to them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, “The LORD commanded through Moses to give us cities to live in, with their pasturelands for our livestock.”
verses.comment: At Shiloh: the religious center at that time.

verses.text: So by command of the LORD, the people of Israel gave to the Levites from their inheritance these cities with their pasturelands.
verses.comment: Each tribe provided cities for the Levites as commanded.

verses.text: The allotment fell by lot for the families of the Kohathites. So those Levites who were descendants of Aaron the priest received by lot thirteen cities from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
verses.comment: Descendants of Aaron were the priestly line among the Kohathites.

verses.text: The rest of the descendants of Kohath received by lot ten cities from the clans of the half-tribe of Ephraim, from the tribe of Dan, and from the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.comment: Distinguishes between Aaronite and non-Aaronite Kohathites.

verses.text: The descendants of Gershon received by lot thirteen cities from the clans of the tribe of Issachar, from the tribe of Asher, from the tribe of Naphtali, and from the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
verses.comment: Gershon was another son of Levi.

verses.text: The descendants of Merari according to their clans were given twelve cities from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
verses.comment: Merari was the third son of Levi.

verses.text: These cities and their pasturelands the people of Israel gave by lot to the Levites, as the LORD had commanded through Moses.
verses.comment: Summary of the allocation according to the LORD’s command.

verses.text: From the tribe of Judah and the tribe of Simeon they gave the following cities mentioned by name:
verses.comment: The following list details specific cities.

verses.text: These were for the descendants of Aaron, who were among the clans of the Kohathites, who were of the sons of Levi, because the first lot was theirs.
verses.comment: Aaron’s descendants were priestly and had first choice.

verses.text: They gave them Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron; Arba was the father of Anak) in the hill country of Judah, with the surrounding pasturelands.
verses.comment: Noting Hebron was formerly Kiriath-arba.

verses.text: But the fields of the city and its villages had been given to Caleb the son of Jephunneh as his possession.
verses.comment: Caleb received the surrounding fields as part of his inheritance.

verses.text: To the descendants of Aaron the priest they gave Hebron, the city of refuge for the manslayer, with its pasturelands, Libnah with its pasturelands,
verses.comment: Hebron served as a city of refuge.

verses.text: Jattir with its pasturelands, Eshtemoa with its pasturelands,
Holon with its pasturelands, Debir with its pasturelands,
Ain with its pasturelands, Juttah with its pasturelands, Beth-shemesh with its pasturelands—nine cities from these two tribes.
verses.comment: Lists sum up nine total cities.

verses.text: From the tribe of Benjamin: Gibeon with its pasturelands, Geba with its pasturelands,
Anathoth with its pasturelands, Almon with its pasturelands—four cities.
The cities of the descendants of Aaron, the priests, were thirteen in all, with their pasturelands.
verses.comment: Total number given matches the list.

verses.text: As for the families of the rest of the Kohathites of the Levites: the cities allotted to them came from the tribe of Ephraim.
They gave them Shechem, the city of refuge for the manslayer, with its pasturelands in the hill country of Ephraim, Gezer with its pasturelands,
verses.comment: Shechem was a city of refuge.

verses.text: Kibzaim with its pasturelands, Beth-horon with its pasturelands—four cities.
From the tribe of Dan: Elteke with its pasturelands, Gibbethon with its pasturelands,
Aijalon with its pasturelands, Gath-rimmon with its pasturelands—four cities.
From the half-tribe of Manasseh: Taanach with its pasturelands, Gath-rimmon with its pasturelands—two cities.
verses.comment: Note the repetition of Gath-rimmon; may be a textual variant.

verses.text: All the cities with their pasturelands for the families of the rest of the Kohathites were ten.

And to the descendants of Gershon, from the families of the half-tribe of Manasseh: Golan in Bashan, the city of refuge for the manslayer, with its pasturelands, and Be-eshterah with its pasturelands—two cities;
verses.comment: Golan was another city of refuge.

verses.text: From the tribe of Issachar: Kishion with its pasturelands, Daberath with its pasturelands,
Jarmuth with its pasturelands, En-gannim with its pasturelands—four cities.
From the tribe of Asher: Mishal with its pasturelands, Abdon with its pasturelands,
Helkath with its pasturelands, Rehob with its pasturelands—four cities.
From the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee, the city of refuge for the manslayer, with its pasturelands, Hammoth-dor with its pasturelands, and Kartan with its pasturelands—three cities.
verses.comment: Kedesh was a city of refuge.

verses.text: All the cities of the Gershonites according to their clans were thirteen cities with their pasturelands.
verses.comment: Reflects sum of listed cities.

verses.text: And to the families of the descendants of Merari, the rest of the Levites: from the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam with its pasturelands, Kartah with its pasturelands,
Dimnah with its pasturelands, Nahalal with its pasturelands—four cities.
From the tribe of Reuben: Bezer with its pasturelands, Jahaz with its pasturelands,
verses.comment: Bezer was a city of refuge.

verses.text: Kedemoth with its pasturelands, Mephaath with its pasturelands—four cities.
From the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead, the city of refuge for the manslayer, with its pasturelands, Mahanaim with its pasturelands,
verses.comment: Ramoth was a city of refuge.

verses.text: Heshbon with its pasturelands, Jazer with its pasturelands—four cities in all.
All these were the cities for the descendants of Merari according to their families, the rest of the clans of the Levites; their allotment was twelve cities.
verses.comment: Recaps their allocation.

verses.text: So all the cities of the Levites in the midst of the property of the people of Israel were forty-eight cities with their pasturelands.
verses.comment: Total number per Moses’ command.

verses.text: These cities, each with its pasturelands surrounding it; so it was with all these cities.
verses.comment: Each city included space for flocks.

verses.text: So the LORD gave to Israel all the land that he swore to give to their fathers. They took possession of it, and they lived in it.
verses.comment: This verse recaps fulfillment of God's promise.

verses.text: And the LORD gave them rest on every side, just as he had sworn to their fathers. Not one of all their enemies stood against them. The LORD gave all their enemies into their hands.
verses.comment: God’s promise for rest and victory was accomplished.

verses.text: Not one word of all the good promises that the LORD made to the house of Israel failed; all came to pass.
verses.comment: Conclusion: every word of God's promise was fulfilled.
